It is a small, terrestrial herb that typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in tropical or subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, creeping stems and small, clustered leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Serpocaulon dasypleuron is considered a vulnerable species in many areas.
